item.title: Butter Chicken
item.description:
Easy to make chicken shovel food. Pairs great with grains like rice.

  • â²ï¸ Cook time: 40 min
  • ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: a full pot!

Ingredients

  • 1 yellow onion
  • 6 cloves of garlic
  • 3 tbsp ginger
  • 3/4 cup butter
  • 1 tbsp curry powder
  • 2 tbsp garam masala spice blend
  • 2 lbs chicken
  • pinch of black pepper
  • 1/2 tsp salt
  • 1/4 cup tomato paste
  • one 28 oz can of crushed tomatoes
  • 1 1/2 cup heavy cream OR one 14 oz can of coconut milk
  • 1 cup of cashews (optional, but elevating)
  • 1 lime

Garam masala blend from scratch (everything ground):

  • 1 tbsp cumin
  • 1 1/2 tsp coriander
  • 1 1/2 tsp cardamom
  • 1 1/2 tsp black pepper
  • 1 tsp cinnamon
  • 1/2 tsp cloves
  • 1/2 tsp nutmeg

Directions

  1. Chop onion, mince garlic and ginger. Cut chicken into 1" chunks.
  2. Add butter to the pot, melt.
  3. Add curry, garam masala, and chicken. Stir, let it cook.
  4. Add onion, garlic and ginger. Cook until chicken is lightly browned, around 5 minutes.
  5. Add pinch of black pepper and salt.
  6. Add tomato paste, stir.
  7. Add crushed tomatoes, heavy cream OR coconut milk and cashews.
  8. Simmer for 25 minutes on low heat and stir occasionally. Check for chicken to get cooked inside.
  9. In the end, add juice of one lime.
  10. Serve over rice or other grain.

Basic rice. IDFK which rice specifically, just rice.

  • ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 4 - 6

Ingredients

  • 2 cups of rice
  • 3 cups of water
  • salt to taste (1 tbsp)

Directions

  1. Wash rice until water is not as cloudy anymore.
  2. Get to boiling on medium to high heat.
  3. Add salt.
  4. Cover, let cook on low heat for 20 minutes until there’s no more water on the bottom. DON’T MIX!
  5. Turn the heat off, let it be covered for 10 minutes.

item.title: Cucumber Spicy Salad
item.description:
Another easy spicy Korean salad!

  • â²ï¸ Prep time: 20 min
  • ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 1 to 3

Ingredients

  • Cucumbers, as much as you can eat. Adjust other ingredients accordingly (by heart).
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1 tbsp gochugaru
  • 1 tbsp chopped scallion
  • 1/2 tsp minced garlic
  • 1 tsp vinegar
  • 1/2 tsp sugar
  • 1 tsp sesame seeds
  • 1 tsp sesame oil

Directions

  1. Cut cucumbers into thin, round slices.
  2. Toss with 1 tsp salt and set aside for 15 minutes for liquid to drain.
  3. Drain liquid. Add the rest of the ingredients.
  4. Mix and serve!

Cucumber salad will get better the longer it stands in the fridge.

item.title: Sour Cream Beef
item.description:
Easy option to get rid of beef.

  • ğŸ³ Cook time: 1 hour, +/- 30 min
  • ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 4 to 6

Ingredients

  • Beef chunk (probably 2 to 3 cups in volume when cut)
  • 3+ tbsp sour cream
  • Oil for frying
  • 1/2 onion
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • About 1 cup of water

Directions

  1. Cut beef into thin strips.
  2. On a high heat, pan fry the beef until water is gone. Beef should have a nice crust.
  3. Cut the onion, add to the beef, fry for a little bit. Add salt and pepper to taste.
  4. Add water, lower the heat to low, close the lid and fry for 40 min to an hour.
  5. In the end add sour cream and leave for 5 minutes to let everything get warm again.

item.title: Soy Bean Banchan
item.description:
Easy salad if you have bean sprouts. Omit the soy sauce and gochugaru for a mild version.

  • â²ï¸ Prep time: 10 min
  • ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 1 to 3

Ingredients

  • Bean sprouts, as much as you can eat. Adjust other ingredients if there’s not enough.
  • Scallions
  • Garlic
  • 1 tbsp sesame oil
  • 1 tsp sesame seeds
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1 tbsp soy sauce (for spicy version)
  • 1-2 tsp gochugaru (for spicy version)

Directions

  1. Boil the sprouts for 3 minutes and shock them with cold water.
  2. Add chopped scallion, minced garlic, sesame oil, sesame seeds, salt and pepper.
  3. For spicy version, add soy sauce and gochugaru.
  4. Mix and serve!

item.title: Turtle Cookies
item.description:
Delicious, indulging chocolate cookies - there no other cookie that matches it!

  • â²ï¸ Prep time: 1 hr 30 min
  • ğŸ³ Cook time: 12 min per sheet
  • ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: about 16 cookies.

Ingredients

Dough

  • 1 cup pecans
  • 1 cup flour
  • 1/3 cup cocoa
  • 1/2 tsp salt
  • 1/2 tsp baking soda
  • 1/2 cup soft butter
  • 1/3 cup sugar
  • 1/2 cup brown sugar
  • 1 egg
  • 1 tbsp vanilla
  • 1/2 cup chocolate chips
  • 1/2 cup caramel chips

Ganache

  • 1/3 cup chocolate chips
  • 3 tbsp butter

Directions

  1. Chop and roast pecans.
  2. Mix flour, cocoa, salt and soda.
  3. In a separate bowl, cream butter.
  4. Add both sugars and mix until light and fluffy.
  5. Add egg and vanilla, mix.
  6. Add dry ingredients to wet ingredients. Mix, but don’t overmix or you’ll get a tough cookie.
  7. Add 3/4 cup pecans, chocolate and caramel chips. Mix by hand.
  8. â³â„ï¸ Chill the dough for 1 hour in the fridge.
  9. Pre-heat the oven to 350 F.
  10. Make balls of dough, put on parchment paper 2 inches apart. Decorate with bits of pecans, chocolate and caramel bits.
  11. Bake cookies 350 F for 10 - 12 minutes until they puff, expand, and the tops are dry.
  12. For ganache, microwave (or otherwise heat, can use residual heat from the oven) the ingredients and mix.
  13. Decorate the cookies with ganache.
  14. Serve slightly chilled with milk.

item.title: Coffee Cake
item.description:
If Bux didn’t popularize the coffee cake, did it really exist?

  • â²ï¸ Prep time: 40 min to 1 hr
  • ğŸ³ Cook time: 1 hr
  • ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 6 to 8

Ingredients

Cinnamon filling

  • 3/4 cups brown sugar
  • 2 tsp cinnamon
  • 1/4 cup flour

Streussel topping

  • 2/3 cups brown sugar
  • 1/4 tsp salt
  • 2 tsp cinnamon
  • 1 cup flour
  • 1/2 cup butter, cold-to-room temperature

Dry

  • 2 1/4 cups flour, sifted
  • 1/4 cup corn starch
  • 3/4 tsp salt
  • 2 1/2 tsp baking powder (not heaping, can use slightly less)

Wet

  • ğŸŒ¡ï¸ 3/4 cups butter, room temperature
  • 1 cup sugar
  • 1/2 cup brown sugar
  • ğŸŒ¡ï¸ 3 eggs, room temperature
  • 2 tsp vanilla extract
  • 1 cup sour cream

Directions

  1. Mix all ingredients for cinnamon filling in a small bowl, set aside.
  2. Mix everything but the butter for streussel topping in a separate bowl. Add grated butter in, mix by hand. Should have a crumbly mixture, set aside.
  3. Mix all dry ingredients in a separate bowl.
  4. In a large bowl, cream butter from wet ingredients.
  5. Add both sugars to the butter from wet ingredients, mix.
  6. Add eggs one-by-one to wet ingredients, mix.
  7. Add the rest of the wet ingredients. Mix.
  8. Combine wet and dry ingredients by hand. Don’t overmix, should be a thick batter.
  9. Line a 8x8 (9x9 would also be ok) pan with parchment paper.
  10. Pour half of the batter into the pan, spread.
  11. Add cinnamon filling.
  12. Pour other half of the batter, spread.
  13. Add streussel topping.
  14. Bake 350 F for 50 minutes, check with wooden skewer for readiness, add time if needed.

item.title: Fudgy Brownies
item.description:
Best brownies you’ll ever make. Just make sure they don’t dry out.

  • â²ï¸ Prep time: 20 min
  • ğŸ³ Cook time: 30 min
  • ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 6 - 9 pieces

Ingredients

  • 1 cup butter
  • 1 tbsp coffee
  • 1 tbsp vanilla extract
  • 1 cup sugar
  • 1 cup brown sugar
  • 3 eggs, room temperature
  • 1 cup flour
  • 3/4 cup cocoa powder
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1 cup chocolate chips
  • 1 cup chopped nuts (optional, can be roasted)

Directions

  1. Melt butter and mix it with coffee, vanilla, and both sugars. Whisk until combined.
  2. Add in the eggs.
  3. Add flour mixed with cocoa powder and salt. Whisk together and switch to folding because the batter will be thick.
  4. Add chocolate chips and nuts at this stage. The whole step is optional but I won’t recommend leaving out chocolate chips.
  5. Line pan with parchment paper.
  6. Spread batter in the pan, can top with more chocolate chips.
  7. Bake 350 F for 30 minutes or until the skewer comes out fairly clean. Brownie should be glossy on the top and fudgy in the middle.
  8. Cool down and serve or be a heathen and consume hot brownie with milk.

item.title: Hot Milk Cake
item.description:
A very easy sponge cake that would be consumed in a matter of seconds.

  • â²ï¸ Prep time: 10 min
  • ğŸ³ Cook time: 30 min
  • ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 8-10 pieces

Ingredients

  • 1 cup whole milk
  • 1/2 cup butter
  • 2 cup flour
  • 2 tsp baking powder (no heap)
  • 1/2 tsp salt
  • 2 cup sugar
  • 4 eggs
  • 1 1/2 tsp vanilla extract
  • Powdered sugar (garnish, optional)

Directions

  1. Pre-heat the oven 350 F. Grease 9x13" pan or alternatively line it with parchment paper.
  2. Heat whole milk with butter until bubbling and butter is melted, about 5 minutes.
  3. Mix flour, baking powder and salt in a separate bowl.
  4. In another bowl, mix sugar and eggs until fluffy, about 3-4 minutes.
  5. Add flour mix to egg mix, mix on low until just incorporated.
  6. Still mixing, add hot butter-milk mixture and vanilla extract, stir until combined.
  7. Pour batter into the baking pan, bake 350 F about 30 minutes until lightly browned on the outside.
  8. Let cool completely on a rack and dust with powdered sugar before serving.

item.title: Summer Berry Danish
item.description:
This is a very nice, but a very time-consuming buttery, berry, creamy danish.

  • â²ï¸ Prep time: 4 hr
  • ğŸ³ Cook time: 30 min
  • ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 2 danishes

Ingredients

Dough

  • 1 cup (250ml) warm whole milk (110-115Â°F)
  • 1 (0.25oz) package (7g) or 2 1/4 teaspoons Red Star Active Dry Yeast
  • 3 cups (360g) all-purpose flour
  • 3 tablespoons granulated sugar
  • 1 teaspoon table salt
  • 1/2 cup (113g) cold unsalted butter, cubed
  • 3 large egg yolks
  • Egg Wash: 1 large egg + 1 teaspoon water; whisk together

Filling

  • ğŸŒ¡ï¸ 1 (8oz) package (226g) cream cheese, at room temperature
  • 3/4 cup (150g) granulated sugar
  • 1 large egg
  • 2 cups berries (raspberries, blueberries and blackberries), frozen are OK

Icing

  • 1 cup (227g) powdered sugar, sifted
  • 2-3 tablespoons milk or cream

Directions

  1. Prepare the dough: Combine the warm milk and yeast and stir slightly to combine. Let sit for 5-10 minutes.
  2. Meanwhile, combine the flour, sugar and salt in a large bowl. Grate cold butter to the mix.
  3. Whisk together the yeast mixture and the egg yolks and add all at once to the flour mixture. Stir with a wooden spoon just until it forms a sticky dough. Do not knead.
  4. â³â„ï¸ Cover with plastic wrap and chill for at least 2 hours.
  5. Turn out the chilled dough onto a floured surface and roll it into a large rectangle about 15 inches wide. Fold the dough in thirds like you would a business letter, then roll it out again. Repeat 2 more times.
  6. â³â„ï¸ Fold the dough in thirds again and cover with plastic wrap. Chill for at least 30 minutes and up to 3 days.
  7. Make the filling: With either a mixer or by hand, beat the cream cheese, sugar and egg until smooth.
  8. Assemble the braid: Divide the chilled dough into two equal pieces. Roll each half out into an approximate 12Ã—6-inch rectangle. Transfer each rectangle to its own a sheet pan lined with parchment paper. Score the rectangle so that it is divided into thirds lengthwise, careful not to slice all the way through. You will use this as a guide.
  9. With a sharp knife or bench scraper, cut the outer thirds into twelve 1-inch strips at a slight angle.
  10. Remove the 2 segments from the top of the dough and bottom of the dough, leaving 2 flaps.
  11. Spread filling into the center of each dough rectangle, leaving about 1 inch border at the top and bottom. Top with berries or desired fruit.
  12. To make a faux braid, fold top and bottom flaps over filling. Starting at the top, take one dough strip and fold it over the filling. Fold the dough strip from the other side over the top, overlapping the first one slightly. Repeat all the way down.
  13. â³ Cover with plastic wrap and let rise for about 30 minutes, or until indentation remains after lightly touching with fingertip.
  14. Preheat oven to 375Â°F.
  15. When ready to bake, brush with egg wash. Bake until crust is golden brown, about 25 to 30 minutes. Let cool to room temperature.
  16. Make the icing: Whisk together the powdered sugar and milk or cream until smooth. Drizzle over the cooled Danish braid. Serve and enjoy!

item.title: Tsvetayevsky Apple Pie
item.description:
Need to get rid of apples? Just bake this great pie.

  • â²ï¸ Prep time: 20 to 30 min.
  • ğŸ³ Cook time: 50 min
  • ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 8 - 10 slices

Ingredients

Dough

  • 2 1/4 cup flour
  • 3/4 cup sour cream
  • 1 cup butter, room temperature
  • 3/4 tsp baking soda bubbled with vinegar

Cream filling

  • 2 cups sour cream
  • 2 eggs
  • 2 cups sugar
  • 4 tbsp flour

Filling

  • About 5 apples

Directions

  1. Mix all dough ingredients.
  2. Create a pie border in a round tin 9 to 11 inches in diameter.
  3. Clean and thinly slice the apples, add them to the tin.
  4. Mix all cream ingredients, pour over apples.
  5. Bake 355 F, 50 minutes.

item.title: Tteokbokki
item.description:
Popular Korean street food is within your grasp with the right ingredients stockpiled from H-mart.

  • â²ï¸ Prep time: 5 min
  • ğŸ³ Cook time: 10 min
  • ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 1

Ingredients

Base

  • A handful of frozen rice cakes, maybe 1 cup. I do as much as I can eat.

Sauce

  • About 2/3 cup of water
  • 1 tbsp gochujang
  • 2 tbsp soy sauce
  • 1 tsp gochugaru
  • 1 tsp garlic (fresh or powder, optional)
  • 1-2 tbsp sugar
  • Cheese cubes (any cheese will do, I use babybel. Optional)

Garnish

  • 2 tbsp sesame oil
  • A sprinkle of sesame seeds
  • A sprinkle of chopped green onions

Directions

  1. Add all sauce ingredients to a pan without the cheese on medium to high heat.
  2. Add rice cakes.
  3. Stir until the sauce is almost desired consistency and rice cakes seem fairly cooked through. About 5-7 min.
  4. Lower the heat, add cheese and cover for additional 3 minutes for cheese to melt.
  5. Dump into a bowl.
  6. Add garnish and enjoy immediately.

item.title: Finnish Salmon Soup
item.description:
This soup is also known as Lohikeitto.

  • â²ï¸ Prep time: 20 min
  • ğŸ³ Cook time: 30 min
  • ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 6-8

Ingredients

  • 2 pcs salmon fillet
  • 4 cups water or stock
  • 1 leek
  • 1/4 cup butter
  • 5-7 potatoes
  • 1-2 carrots
  • 1 cup heavy cream
  • salt and pepper to taste
  • dill to garnish

Directions

  1. Wash, clean, and dice all vegetables.
  2. Remove scales from salmon fillet or remove skin entirely, up to you. Dice.
  3. In a pot, melt butter. Add diced leeks and cook on medium-high about 5 minutes until the leeks wilt a bit.
  4. Add water (or stock) and other vegetables. Bring to a boil and cook on medium heat about 10-15 minutes until the potatoes are ready.
  5. Add diced salmon fillet and heavy cream. Cook for additional 5-10 minutes to cook the salmon.
  6. Add salt and pepper to taste at the end. Serve with dill as garnish.
